data.title: INDEPENDENT AND BASE FILMS SHOWING JUNE 22 TO 28
data.text:
Lynwood

4569 Lynwood Center Road NE, Bainbridge Island, (206) 842-3080

'Paris Je T'Aime'

(R, 2:00)

Showing: Tonight through Sunday — 3:20, 7:10; Monday through Thursday — 7:10, 9:30

A collection of 18 shorts features by different directors features 18 distinctive neighborhoods of the romantic city of Paris, and what emerges is a modes but richly sculpted quilt of many colors and moods. Directors include Gurinder Chadha, Alexander Payne, the Coen brothers and Gus Van Sant, and the cast includes Steve Buscemi, Gena Rowlands and Juliette Binoche.

'The Valet'

(PG-13, 1:25)

Showing: Friday through Sunday — 5:00, 9:30; Monday through Thursday — 5:00

See full review, Page 23.

Rose

235 Taylor St., Port Townsend, (360) 385-1089:

'Gracie'

(PG, 1:30)

Showing: Daily — 4:00See full review, Page 22.

'Jindabyne'

(R, 2:03)

Showing: Daily — 7:00

See full review, Page 26.

'Private Fears in Public Places'

(NR, 2:00)

Showing: Daily — 4:30, 7:30

See full review, Page 25.

Grand

606 Fawcett, Tacoma, (253) 593-4474, grandcinema.com:

'Once'

(R, 1:28)

Showing: Today — 2:10, 4:00, 6:20, 8:30; Saturday, Sunday — 12:15, 2:10, 4:00, 6:20, 8:30; Monday through Wednesday — 4:00, 6:20, 8:30; Thursday — 2:10, 4:00, 6:20, 8:30

A modern-day musical set in the streets of Dublin, featuring Glen Hansard and his Irish band The Frames, it tells the story of a street musician and a Czech immigrant during an eventful week as they write, rehearse and record songs that reveal their unique love story.

'Paris Je T'Aime'

(R, 2:00)

Showing: Today — 2:20, 6:35, 9:00; Saturday, Sunday — 11:45 a.m., 2:20, 6:35, 9:00; Monday through Wednesday — 6:35, 9:00; Thursday — 2:20, 6:35, 9:00

See capsule review for Lynwood Theatre.

'Waitress'

(R, 1:44)

Showing: Today — 2:15, 4:30, 6:45, 8:50; Saturday through Monday — noon, 2:15, 4:30, 6:45, 8:50; Tuesday, Wednesday — 4:30, 6:45, 8:50; Thursday — 2:15, 4:30, 6:45, 8:50

An audience hit at the Sundance Film Festival, "Waitress" serves up a sweet, sassy and delicious slice of life tale as it celebrates the power of friendship, motherhood and the willingness to take a chance. Jenna (Keri Russell) is a waitress who bakes out-of-this-world pies. When an awkwardly charming new doctor (Nathan Fillion) comes to town, she's inspired to change the course of events in her life.

'10 Questions for the Dalai Lama'

(NR, 1:25)

Showing: Daily — 4:45

Filmmaker Rick Ray interviews the Dalai Lama, seeking his views on important contemporary issues.

Bangor Cinema Plus

(360) 535-5923 or navylifepnw.com:

Saturday: Free matinee — 1 p.m., "The Spongebob Squarepants Movie" (PG); Double feature — 7 p.m., "Next" (PG-13); 9:30 p.m., "Georgia Rule" (PG-13)

Sunday: Double feature — 5 p.m., "Hot Fuzz" (R); 7:15 p.m., "Fracture" (R)

Wednesday: All seats $1: 7 p.m., "Spider-Man 3" (PG-13)

Thursday: Double feature — 7 p.m., "28 Weeks Later" (R); 9:15 p.m., "Lucky You" (PG-13)
